revised_title: Researches on Solar Physics and Sunspot Observations
tldr: The authors present the third installment of the determination of sunspot areas and heliographic positions using the Kew photoheliograph for the years 1867, 1868, and 1869. They discuss the superiority of photographic sun-observations over previous methods and the distribution of sunspots on the solar surface. The authors also express a hope for more extensive solar observations in the future, connecting solar phenomena with terrestrial meteorology and magnetism.
